Text: BOC Gases ContractTerrel and I had a conference call with BOC this morning The call was very positive as they were still interested in talking with us They had a number of questions regarding the contract terms and seems like they want to sign something by week end I need clarification on a few issues that they raised We need to give them answers tommorow Proposed Contract terms Houston Zone MW per settlement Interval South Zone MW per settlement Interval North Zone MW per settlement Interval West Zone MW per settlement Interval BOC going to Balancing Energy charges outside the band Interruptibility BOC wanted to understand the mechanics Specifically they wanted to know how Enron would work with them to maximize curtailment opportunities They also wanted to know the quantity they could curtail eg If deal is MW can BOC curtail MW or just MW Also do they pay any penalty when they curtail etc Scheduled maintenance Can they sell contract power a week forward Is there any penalty for not being within the band during those hours BOC wants a fixed price quote for all Ancillaries and ERCOT Passthroughs However they want the ability to unwind this fixed price position should they feel they are better off with ERCOT market prices once the market becomes more transparent What is Enrons ability to provide such a service BOC doesnt like the charge in excess of Balancing Energy everytime they are outside the Quantity Band They said that they dont want to pay more when prices are high and they are outside the band They want a fixed fee instead of of BES price Given the bands we have placed in the contract BOC was outside the band a of the time in their Houston Zone Interval Load b of the time in their South Zone Interval Load c less than of the time in their North Zone Interval Load d of the time in their South Zone Interval Load Regards Rahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax
ERCOT Research Model Meeting Rescheduledsmith PST When Wednesday October PM PM GMT Central Time US Canada Where EB
Rahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax

Valuing ERCOT Industrial LoadI met with the Research team responsible for building a model for EES and ran through the model The model can be used to value ERCOT deals or at least we can use it as a benchmark for pricing I have attached a document that summarizes what EES is using the model to price and how we can use it to price our deals I am out tomorrow but will be back in the office Wed morning Research is looking at historical ERCOT prices and customer load data TXI I will set up a meeting on Wednesday to further discuss the model and other issues associated with deal valuation Call me on my cell if you need to reach me Regards Rahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax

New Load Databelow is a list of the cos that have recently sent us load data but are not in the database All folders are in MUser PubToddERCOT RegionActive List Folder Subfolder File Tab Zone Notes AEP PTB CPL CPL Power Data Indexed Data South Column E contains load data Chevron None LoadshapeSetupChevron Sheet SouthWestNorth Diamond Shamrock None IDRData both tabs South Nucor None NucorLoadData Matrix To Column North Column AC contains load data GM None Consolidated Accts Interval Data Matrix To Column North Column AC contains load data this is all for now Ill keep you updated on all new info we get Thks Rahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax

FW ERCOT ModelOriginal Message From Seksaria Rahul Sent Wednesday November PM To Gilbertsmith Doug Wang Steve Trefz Greg Subject ERCOT Model The model is attached I can run u guys through the rationale and see what you think u need to save the LoadDealdll file in CWINNT before running it Rahul Rahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax

Valuing ERCOT Industrial LoadI met with the Research team responsible for building a model for EES and ran through the model The model can be used to value ERCOT deals or at least we can use it as a benchmark for pricing I have attached a document that summarizes what EES is using the model to price and how we can use it to price our deals I am out tomorrow but will be back in the office Wed morning Research is looking at historical ERCOT prices and customer load data TXI I will set up a meeting on Wednesday to further discuss the model and other issues associated with deal valuation Call me on my cell if you need to reach me Regards Rahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax

FW PSIM ModelRahul Seksaria Enron Corp Smith Street Ste A Tel Fax Original Message From Wang Steve Sent Thursday September PM To Seksaria Rahul Subject FW PSIM Model Original Message From Huang Alex Sent Thursday September PM To Wang Steve Subject PSIM Model Steve Attached please find the model and other files Put Fronteradll in Cwinnt directory The rest of the files can be put in one directory of your choice PSIMdoc is a word file contains background info The same info is contained in PSIM HELPHLP which you can access directly from Fronteraxls When you open up Fronteraxls a tab called Power Simulator will show up in the tool bar Click on it you can find PSIM Help which links to the help file To run the model you click Power Simulator and select Write Asset Files then you lick Power Simulator and Simulate to run Afterward click Power Simulator and Create Result Sheet to create an excel sheet for result Call me for any questions Best Alex
